intro: Ouratea caracasana, commonly known as the Caracas ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
